questions.question: Why did the United States formulate the Open Door policy toward China?

choices.answer: to develop democratic institutions and practices in China.
to prevent a European and Japanese monopoly of Chinese trade & markets.
to establish a military presence on the Chinese mainland.
to support Japanese efforts to industrialize China.

questions.question: During the late 19th and early 20th centuries, United States policy toward Latin America was characterized by
The idea that the U.S. has the right to act as the "policeman of the Western Hemisphere" was established by

choices.answer: Roosevelt Corollary to the Monroe Doctrine

questions.question: "We must find new markets for our produce".  This statement provides a reason for U.S. _________
Yellow journalists created support for the Spanish-American War by writing articles about the

choices.answer: political popularity of William Jennings Bryan
efforts of the United States to control Mexico
destruction of United States sugar plantations by Hawaiians
sinking of the United States battleship Maine in Havana Harbor

questions.question: When the United States entered the war ____

choices.answer: They were unable to affect the stalemate that had developed
they helped turn the war in favor of the Allies
They were unable to make up for the loss of Russia
their inexperience caused heavy damage to the Allies

questions.question: The situation refered to in the headline had what impact on WWI

choices.answer: it turned world opinion against Great Britain
It was one factor that drew the U.S. into World War I.

questions.question: The opposition of some Members of Congress to the Versailles Treaty was based largely on the idea that the treaty

choices.answer: did not punish the Central powers harshly enough
did not give the United States an important role in world affairs
would require the United States to join the League of Nations
Would require the United States to have to help rebuild Europe

questions.question: President Wilson's statement, "The world must be made safe for democracy" was made to justify his decision to

choices.answer: end United States imperialism in Latin America
send troops into Mexico to capture Panch Villa
ask Congress to declare war against Germany

questions.question: Many senators who opposed United States membership in the League of Nations argued that joining the League would

choices.answer: involve the nation in future military conflicts

questions.question: Whic factors were the major causes of the Red Scare and the Palmer raids after WWI.

choices.answer: success of the Communist party in congressional elections
race riots in Los Angeles and the revival of the Ku Klux Klan
failure of the United States to join the League of Nations
The Boshevik Revolution & the workers strike in the United States

questions.question: Data from the graph supports the conclusion that World War I

choices.answer: caused the United States trade deficit to increase
cost the United States many billions of dollars
was a significant benefit to the American economy
created an unfavorable balance of trade

questions.question: Which statement best describes President Theodore Roosevelt's foreign policy toward Latin America

choices.answer: The United States should reduce its involvement in Latin American affairs
The Monroe Doctrine permits the United States to intervene in Latin America
Latin American nations should form organizations to help them achieve
The United States should give finacial aid to help their poor

choices.answer: Hekept us out of the war
